leitej.util.machine

Class ShutdownHookUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • leitej.util.machine.ShutdownHookUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class ShutdownHookUtil
extends java.lang.Thread
    An useful class to help in interact with Runtime.getRuntime().addShutdownHook(Thread).

    If the virtual machine is already in the process of shutting down or if a security manager is present and it denies RuntimePermission("shutdownHooks"), a SeppukuLtRtException with code 1 will be raised.
    Author:
    Julio Leite
    See Also:
    SeppukuLtRtException

      • addToFirst

        public static boolean addToFirst(InvokeItf invoke)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 IllegalStateLtRtException
        Appends the specified element to the list to be called sequentially before generic tasks added by 'add' method. This list will be run in FILO order.
        Parameters:
        invoke - element to be appended to the list
        Returns:
        true (as specified by Collection.add(E))
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified element is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some property of this element prevents it from being added to the list
        IllegalStateLtRtException - if shutdown hook already started

      • remove

        public static boolean remove(InvokeItf invoke)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             IllegalStateLtRtException
        Removes the first occurrence of the specified element from the list, if it is present. If the list does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the element with the lowest index i such that (invoke.equals(get(i))) (if such an element exists). Returns true if the list contained the specified element (or equivalently, if the list changed as a result of the call).
        Parameters:
        invoke - element to be removed from the list, if present
        Returns:
        true if the list contained the specified element
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified element is null
        IllegalStateLtRtException - if shutdown hook already started

        if the shutdown hook has been activated

      • isCurrentThreadFrom

        public static boolean isCurrentThreadFrom()
        Asserts if the thread that calls this method is from this shutdown hook.
        Returns:
        if current thread is from this shutdown hook
